title: 2008 IRB Pacific Nations Cup
text:
The 2008 <a href="Pacific%20Nations%20Cup">Pacific Nations Cup</a> was a <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> tournament held between six national sides on the <a href="Pacific%20Rim">Pacific Rim</a>: <a href="Australia%20A%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Australia A</a>, <a href="Fiji%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Fiji</a>, <a href="Japan%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Japan</a>, <a href="Samoa%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Samoa</a>, <a href="Tonga%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Tonga</a> and <a href="New%20Zealand%20M%C4%81ori%20rugby%20union%20team">New Zealand Māori</a> (just for this year). The inaugural competition was held in 2006. This year the tournament started on 7 June and ended on 6 July 2008.
The tournament is a round-robin where each team plays all of the other teams once. There are four points for a win, two for a draw and none for a defeat. There are also bonus points offered with one bonus point for scoring four or more tries in a match and one bonus point for losing by 7 points or less.
